Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.dual_bios_auto_recovery.dual_bios_auto_recovery

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import time
import os
import shutil

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.system_config import SystemConfig


[docs]class DualBiosAutoRecovery(TestBase):
    """
    TODO:
    - The run_yafuflash_oob() method is used in a few test cases already.
      Someone should put this into a library so all test cases can use it!
    """


[docs]    def __init__(self, corrupt_bin, bios_image_a, bios_image_b,
            Yafuflash_zip, bios_tool_tar,
            bios_cfg_frb2_enabled, bios_cfg_frb2_disabled):
        super(DualBiosAutoRecovery, self).__init__()
        self.corrupt_bin = corrupt_bin
        self.bios_image_a = bios_image_a
        self.bios_image_b = bios_image_b
        self.Yafuflash_zip = Yafuflash_zip
        self.bios_tool_tar = bios_tool_tar
        self.bios_cfg_frb2_enabled = bios_cfg_frb2_enabled
        self.bios_cfg_frb2_disabled = bios_cfg_frb2_disabled
        self.file_dep_rootdir = "/mnt/vol/havoc/autoval/bin/leopard_fw/"



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the Dual BIOS OOB Upgrade Test")

        # Setup: Make sure auto BIOS recovery is off. If it's left on,
        # sometimes when using Yafuflash, it will trigger the ABR to occur,
        # which prevents the system from booting and this test fails.
        self.host.oob.set_dual_bios_auto_recovery(enable=False)
        self.host.oob.set_sel_log_filter(critical_only=False)

        self.setup_files()

        # Programming secondary B -> boot up
        self.log_info("Programming Golden BIOS to ver %s" % self.bios_image_a)
        self.flash_golden_bios_oob(self.bios_image_a)

        # Programming to primary A -> boot up
        self.log_info("Programming the Primary BIOS to ver %s" %
                self.bios_image_b)
        self.flash_bios_oob(self.bios_image_b)
        cur_primary_bios = self.get_bios_info()
        good_primary_bios = self.bios_image_b.replace(".BIN", "")
        self.validate_condition(cur_primary_bios == good_primary_bios,
                "Primary BIOS Version Check")

        # Clear the SEL logs so that we know all records are from this test only
        self.host.oob.sel_clear()

        self.host.oob.set_dual_bios_auto_recovery(enable=True)
        self.set_auto_recovery_timer_in_bios(enable=True)

        self.log_info("Flashing primary BIOS with corrupted binary.")
        self.host.oob.power_off()
        self.run_yafuflash_oob(self.file_dep_rootdir + self.corrupt_bin)
        self.validate_condition(True,
                    "Primary BIOS has been flashed with a corrupt binary file")

        # Give Yafuflash time to finish "cleaning up". This should really only
        # take a second, but we'll give it 30 to be EXTRA sure. If we don't
        # give it this time, then powering on the system will auto-fail, even
        # if the system COULD successfully boot on (which it shouldn't).
        time.sleep(30)

        self.log_info("Attempting to power on system. This should fail.")
        try:
            self.host.oob.power_on()
        except:  # noqa: B001 T25377293 Grandfathered in
            # We want to system to fail at powering on -- means BIOS is corrupt
            self.validate_condition(True,
                            "Host failed to power on because of corrupted BIOS")

        # After failing to power on, the watchdog should trigger in at most 20
        # mins. Then it should take ~3 mins to copy golden BIOS to primary BIOS.
        self.log_info("Waiting 25 minutes to let BIOS auto recovery occur")
        time.sleep(1500)

        self.host.oob.power_on()
        cur_primary_bios = self.get_bios_info()
        expected_primary_bios = self.bios_image_a.replace(".BIN", "")
        self.validate_condition(cur_primary_bios == expected_primary_bios,
                    "Auto recovery copied the golden BIOS to the primary BIOS")

        self.verify_sel_logs()

        # Clean up. Disable the automatic BIOS recovery.
        self.host.oob.set_dual_bios_auto_recovery(enable=False)
        self.set_auto_recovery_timer_in_bios(enable=False)



[docs]    def setup_files(self):
        #Check if the files exist, if so copy it to resultsdir
        file_dep = [self.bios_image_a, self.bios_image_b, self.Yafuflash_zip]

        for onefile in file_dep:
            filename = os.path.join(self.file_dep_rootdir, onefile)
            if not os.path.isfile(filename):
                raise Exception("file %s does not exist" % onefile)
            else:
                shutil.copy(filename, self.resultsdir)

        yafuflash_dir = self.Yafuflash_zip.replace(".zip", "")

        os.chdir(self.resultsdir)
        cmd = "unzip %s" % (self.Yafuflash_zip)
        self.host.localhost.run(cmd)
        cmd = "cp %s/Linux_x86_64/* ." % (yafuflash_dir)
        self.host.localhost.run(cmd)
        cmd = "chmod +x *"
        self.host.localhost.run(cmd)



[docs]    def flash_bios_oob(self, bin_file):
        self.host.oob.power_off()
        self.run_yafuflash_oob(bin_file)
        self.host.oob.power_on()



[docs]    def flash_golden_bios_oob(self, bin_file):
        self.host.oob.power_off()
        self.run_yafuflash_oob(bin_file)
        self.log_info("Dual-BIOS-Update Stage 2: Copying to Golden BIOS")
        self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd("raw 0x30 0x42 0x55 0x66")
        self.log_info("Dual-BIOS-Update Stage 3: \
                Wait for 300s for copy to complete")
        time.sleep(300)
        self.log_info("Dual-BIOS-Update Stage 4: Power On")
        self.host.oob.power_on()



[docs]    def run_yafuflash_oob(self, bin_file):
        cmd = "./Yafuflash -nw -u USERID -p PASSW0RD -vyes -host %s -bios %s" \
                % (self.host.oob.oob_addr, bin_file)
        out = self.host.localhost.run(cmd)
        self.validate_condition("Successfully" in out,
                "flashing BIOS ver %s" % bin_file)



[docs]    def get_bios_info(self):
        cfg = SystemConfig.config_check(self.host)
        return cfg['systeminfo']['bios_version']



[docs]    def set_auto_recovery_timer_in_bios(self, enable):
        """
        This function enables/disables the FRB-2 timer in the BIOS.
        The FRB-2 timer waits a specified amount of time to see if the system
        POSTs. If the system does not post in this time, the auto BIOS
        recovery is triggered. This recovery flashes the Golden BIOS image
        onto the primary BIOS image.

        We can run SCELINUX, give it a host and a BIOS config file, and it will
        apply that BIOS configuration to that host.
        """
        # Copy over bios files and unarchive them
        bios_file = (self.file_dep_rootdir + self.bios_tool_tar)
        bios_tools_dir = self.bios_tool_tar.replace(".tar.gz", "")

        shutil.copy(bios_file, self.resultsdir)
        os.chdir(self.resultsdir)
        self.host.localhost.run('/bin/tar xvf ' + self.resultsdir +
                '/' + self.bios_tool_tar)

        if enable:
            shutil.copy(self.file_dep_rootdir + self.bios_cfg_frb2_enabled,
                    self.resultsdir)
            bios_cfg = self.bios_cfg_frb2_enabled
        else:
            shutil.copy(self.file_dep_rootdir + self.bios_cfg_frb2_disabled,
                    self.resultsdir)
            bios_cfg = self.bios_cfg_frb2_disabled

        # Make SCELNX executable
        scelnx_path = (self.resultsdir + '/' + bios_tools_dir + '/' +
                       'SCELNX_64')
        if(os.path.isfile(scelnx_path) and
                os.access(scelnx_path, os.X_OK)):
            pass
        else:
            self.host.run('chmod +x ' + scelnx_path)

        # Now run SCELNX and apply the bios settings
        self.log_info("Setting FRB-2 Timer in the BIOS.")
        self.host.run(scelnx_path + ' /i /s ' + self.resultsdir + '/' + bios_cfg)
        self.validate_condition(True, "FRB-2 Timer has been set in the BIOS")

        self.log_info("Rebooting system to apply BIOS changes.")
        self.host.oob.power_reset()



[docs]    def verify_sel_logs(self):
        sel_entries = self.host.oob.get_sel_entries()
        auto_recovery_start = False
        auto_recovery_end = False

        for entry in sel_entries:
            try:
                if (entry["Sensor Number"] == "ef" and
                   entry["Event Data"] == "010201"):
                    auto_recovery_start = True
                if (entry["Sensor Number"] == "ef" and
                   entry["Event Data"] == "010202"):
                    auto_recovery_end = True
            except KeyError:
                # If any of these keys don't exist in the sel_entries, then
                # it must be an OEM entry. Just ignore it.
                continue

        self.validate_condition(auto_recovery_start and auto_recovery_end,
                        "SEL logs confirm that the auto BIOS recovery occured.")



[docs]def main():
    test = DualBiosAutoRecovery()
    test.lifecycle()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
